intro: Senecio kacondensis, commonly known as the Congo senecio, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
